  • RestApp API Documentation

RestApp API Documentation¶

RestApp is an asynchronous contact management API built with FastAPI. The following sections detail all components of the application.

API Endpoints (Routers)¶

async src.api.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Confirms the user’s email address using a verification token.

Decodes the token to get the user’s email and updates the user’s confirmation status.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email verification token.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 400 Bad Request if the token is invalid or user is not found.

Returns:

A message indicating the confirmation status.

Return type:

dict

async src.api.auth.login_user(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(dependency=None, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Authenticates a user and generates an access token.

Verifies the username and password against the database. Requires email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • form_data (fastapi.security.OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The username and password provided in the OAuth2 form.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized if login/password is incorrect or email is not confirmed.

Returns:

An object containing the access token and token type.

Return type:

src.schemas.TokenSchema

async src.api.auth.password_reset(body: PasswordReset, token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Sets a new password for the user using a password reset token.

Decodes the token to get the user’s email, verifies the user, and updates the password.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.PasswordReset) – The request body containing the new password.

  • token (str) – The password reset token.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 400 Bad Request if the token is invalid or user is not found.

Returns:

The user object with the updated password (hash).

Return type:

The return type of UserService.set_new_password.

async src.api.auth.register_user(user_data: UserCreate, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Registers a new user in the system.

If the email or username already exists, it raises a 409 Conflict error. It hashes the user’s password and sends a verification email in the background.

Parameters:

  • user_data (src.schemas.UserCreate) – The user registration data.

  • background_tasks (fastapi.BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks object for sending emails.

  • request (fastapi.Request) – The request object to get the base URL.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 409 Conflict if user with email or username already exists.

Returns:

The newly created user object.

Return type:

src.schemas.UserResponse

async src.api.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Requests a new email verification link if the user’s email is not confirmed.

Sends a new verification email in the background if the user exists and is not confirmed.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.RequestEmail) – The request body containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (fastapi.BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks object for sending emails.

  • request (fastapi.Request) – The request object to get the base URL.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Returns:

A message instructing the user to check their email.

Return type:

dict

async src.api.auth.request_password_reset(body: RequestPasswordReset, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Requests a password reset link for the user’s email.

Sends a password reset email in the background.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.RequestPasswordReset) – The request body containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (fastapi.BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks object for sending emails.

  • request (fastapi.Request) – The request object to get the base URL.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Returns:

A message instructing the user to check their email.

Return type:

dict

async src.api.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Creates a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.ContactCreate) – The data for the new contact.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who is creating the contact.

Raises:

HTTPException – 409 Conflict if a contact with the same unique identifier (e.g., email) already exists for the user.

Returns:

The newly created contact object.

Return type:

src.schemas.ContactResponse

async src.api.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts belonging to the current user whose birthdays are upcoming within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who owns the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[src.schemas.ContactResponse]

async src.api.contacts.read_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieves a single contact by its unique ID, ensuring it belongs to the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who owns the contacts.

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 Not Found if the contact does not exist or does not belong to the user.

Returns:

The requested contact object.

Return type:

src.schemas.ContactResponse

async src.api.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts belonging to the current user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip (for pagination). Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Defaults to 100.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who owns the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[src.schemas.ContactResponse]

async src.api.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Deletes a contact by ID, ensuring it belongs to the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who owns the contact.

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 Not Found if the contact does not exist or does not belong to the user.

Returns:

The deleted contact object.

Return type:

src.schemas.ContactResponse

async src.api.contacts.search_contacts(query: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Searches contacts belonging to the current user by matching a query string against the first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The search string (min length 3).

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip (for pagination). Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Defaults to 100.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who owns the contacts.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[src.schemas.ContactResponse]

async src.api.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Updates an existing contact by ID, ensuring it belongs to the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.ContactUpdate) – The update data for the contact.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user who owns the contact.

Raises:

  • HTTPException – 404 Not Found if the contact does not exist or does not belong to the user.

  • HTTPException – 409 Conflict if the update results in a duplicate unique identifier (e.g., email) for the user.

Returns:

The updated contact object.

Return type:

src.schemas.ContactResponse

async src.api.users.me(request: Request, user: UserResponse = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Retrieves the information of the currently authenticated user.

The route is protected by a rate limit of 10 requests per minute per IP address.

Parameters:

  • request (fastapi.Request) – The incoming request object (used by the limiter).

  • user (src.schemas.UserResponse) – The current authenticated user object obtained via dependency injection.

Returns:

The user’s detailed information.

Return type:

src.schemas.UserResponse

async src.api.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(dependency=<function get_admin_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Uploads a new avatar file for the current user and updates the user’s avatar URL in the database.

Note: This endpoint currently uses get_admin_user for authentication, restricting avatar updates to admin users only, based on the provided code structure.

Parameters:

  • file (fastapi.UploadFile) – The avatar image file to be uploaded.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user object (must be an admin based on dependency).

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Returns:

The user object with the newly updated avatar URL.

Return type:

src.schemas.UserResponse

async src.api.utils.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Performs a health check on the API and the underlying database connection.

It executes a simple database query (SELECT 1) to ensure the connection is active and correctly configured.

Parameters:

db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 500 Internal Server Error if the database connection fails or returns an unexpected result.

Returns:

A success message indicating the API is operational.

Return type:

dict

Data Models (Schemas & ORM)¶

class src.schemas.ContactBase(*, first_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=20)], last_name: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=20)], email: Annotated[EmailStr, MaxLen(max_length=50)], phone_number: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=15)], birthday: date, additional_data: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=50)] = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base schema for contact properties shared across creation and representation.

Variables:

  • first_name (str) – Contact’s first name (max 20 chars).

  • last_name (str | None) – Contact’s last name (max 20 chars, optional).

  • email (pydantic.EmailStr) – Contact’s email address (max 50 chars).

  • phone_number (str) – Contact’s phone number (max 15 chars).

  • birthday (datetime.date) – Contact’s date of birth.

  • additional_data (str | None) – Additional notes (max 50 chars, optional).

class src.database.models.Base(**kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: DeclarativeBase

Base class for declarative class definitions. All ORM models in the application should inherit from this class.

metadata: ClassVar[MetaData] = MetaData()¶

Refers to the _schema.MetaData collection that will be used for new _schema.Table objects.

See also

orm_declarative_metadata

registry: ClassVar[registry] = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>¶

Refers to the _orm.registry in use where new _orm.Mapper objects will be associated.

class src.database.models.Contact(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy ORM model representing the ‘contacts’ table.

Stores contact information associated with a specific user.

Variables:

  • id (int) – Primary key integer.

  • first_name (str) – Contact’s first name (String, max 20).

  • last_name (str | None) – Contact’s last name (nullable String, max 20).

  • email (str) – Contact’s email address (String, max 50). Unique per user.

  • phone_number (str) – Contact’s phone number (String, max 15). Unique per user.

  • birthday (datetime.date) – Contact’s date of birth.

  • additional_data (str | None) – Additional notes or data about the contact (nullable String, max 50).

  • user_id (int) – Foreign key linking to the owner user’s ID. Deletes cascade.

  • user (User) – Relationship object linking to the owner user (Many-to-One relationship).

additional_data: Mapped[str | None]¶
birthday: Mapped[date]¶
email: Mapped[str]¶

id: Mapped[int]¶
last_name: Mapped[str | None]¶
phone_number: Mapped[str]¶
user: Mapped[User]¶
user_id: Mapped[int]¶

class src.database.models.User(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy ORM model representing the ‘users’ table.

Users are the owners of contacts and have authentication-related fields.

Variables:

  • id (int) – Primary key integer.

  • username (str) – Unique username (String, max 20).

  • email (str) – Unique email address (String, max 50).

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password string.

  • confirmed (bool) – Boolean indicating if the user’s email is confirmed (default False).

  • avatar (str | None) – URL to the user’s avatar image (nullable String, max 255).

  • refresh_token (str | None) – JWT refresh token for session management (nullable String, max 255).

  • contacts (list['Contact']) – List of contacts associated with this user (One-to-Many relationship).

  • created_at (datetime) – Timestamp of user creation (DateTime, defaults to current time).

  • role (UserRole) – User’s role (defaults to UserRole.USER).

avatar: Mapped[str | None]¶
confirmed: Mapped[bool]¶
contacts: Mapped[list[Contact]]¶
created_at: Mapped[datetime]¶
email: Mapped[str]¶
hashed_password: Mapped[str]¶
id: Mapped[int]¶
refresh_token: Mapped[str | None]¶
role: Mapped[UserRole]¶
username: Mapped[str]¶
class src.database.models.UserRole(value)¶

Bases: str, Enum

Enumeration for user roles within the application.

ADMIN = 'admin'¶
USER = 'user'¶

Services and Business Logic¶

async src.services.auth.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: int | None = None)¶

Creates a new JWT access token based on provided data.

The token includes an expiration time (exp).

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The payload data to encode (e.g., {“sub”: user_email}).

  • expires_delta (int | None) – Optional override for token expiration time in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

src.services.auth.create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Creates a time-limited JWT token specifically for email verification or password reset.

The token is valid for 20 minutes.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The payload data to encode (e.g., {“sub”: user_email}).

Returns:

The encoded email verification token.

Return type:

str

async src.services.auth.get_admin_user(current_user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Dependency function that checks if the current authenticated user has the ‘admin’ role.

This function relies on get_current_user to authenticate first.

Parameters:

current_user (src.database.models.User) – The authenticated user object provided by get_current_user.

Raises:

HTTPException – 403 Forbidden if the user’s role is not ‘admin’.

Returns:

The authenticated User object if they are an admin.

Return type:

src.database.models.User

async src.services.auth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(dependency=<fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))¶

Dependency function to retrieve and authenticate the current user from an access token.

Decodes the JWT, retrieves the user from Redis cache (or database if not cached), and validates credentials. Caches the user for subsequent requests.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token provided in the Authorization header.

  • db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid or the user is not found.

Returns:

The authenticated User object.

Return type:

src.database.models.User

async src.services.auth.get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Decodes an email verification token and extracts the user’s email address.

Parameters:

token (str) – The email verification token.

Raises:

HTTPException – 422 Unprocessable Content if the token is invalid or expired.

Returns:

The email address stored in the token’s payload (“sub” field).

Return type:

str

src.services.auth.get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Generates a secure hash for a given password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain-text password to hash.

Returns:

The generated password hash string.

Return type:

str

src.services.auth.verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verifies a plain-text password against a hashed password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The password provided by the user (plain text).

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password stored in the database.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class src.services.users.UserService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

Service layer for user-related operations.

Handles business logic such as generating default avatars (Gravatar) and delegating CRUD operations to the UserRepository.

Parameters:

db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

async confirmed_email(email: str)¶

Confirms the user’s email address in the database.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address of the user to confirm.

Returns:

The result of the repository operation (None).

Return type:

None

async create_user(body: UserCreate)¶

Creates a new user record.

Before creation, it attempts to generate a default avatar URL using Gravatar based on the user’s email.

Parameters:

body (src.schemas.UserCreate) – The user creation data.

Returns:

The newly created User object.

Return type:

src.database.models.User

async get_user_by_email(email: str)¶

Retrieves a user by their unique email address.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address of the user.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

src.database.models.User | None

Retrieves a user by their unique ID.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

src.database.models.User | None

async get_user_by_username(username: str)¶

Retrieves a user by their unique username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the user.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

src.database.models.User | None

async set_new_password(email: str, new_password_hash: str)¶

Updates the hashed password for a user identified by their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • new_password_hash (str) – The new hashed password string.

Returns:

The updated User object.

Return type:

src.database.models.User

async update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str)¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user identified by their email.

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

Returns:

The updated User object.

src.database.models.User

class src.services.contacts.ContactService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

Service layer for contact-related operations.

This service acts as an intermediary, handling business logic (if any) and exception propagation between the API router and the data repository.

Parameters:

db (sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

async create_contact(body: ContactCreate, user: User)¶

Creates a new contact for the user.

Propagates src.repository.contacts.DuplicateContactError if a unique constraint is violated.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.ContactCreate) – The data for creating the new contact.

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The user who owns the new contact.

Raises:

DuplicateContactError – If a contact with the same unique data already exists.

Returns:

The newly created Contact object.

Return type:

src.database.models.Contact

  • user (src.database.models.User) – The owner of the contact.

The Contact object if found, otherwise None.

Searches contacts by matching the query against first name, last name, or email.

  • skip (int) – The number of records to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of records to return.

  • body (src.schemas.ContactUpdate) – The data containing fields to update.

src.services.email.conf = ConnectionConfig(MAIL_USERNAME='example@smtp.com', MAIL_PASSWORD=SecretStr('**********'), MAIL_PORT=465, MAIL_SERVER='smtp.example.com', MAIL_STARTTLS=False, MAIL_SSL_TLS=True, MAIL_DEBUG=0, MAIL_FROM='noreply@example.com', MAIL_FROM_NAME='RestApp Support', TEMPLATE_FOLDER=PosixPath('/Users/Bigmasy/VSCProject/python/goit-pythonweb-hw-12/src/services/templates'), SUPPRESS_SEND=0, USE_CREDENTIALS=True, VALIDATE_CERTS=True, TIMEOUT=60, LOCAL_HOSTNAME=None, CERT_BUNDLE=None)¶

Configuration object for connecting to the SMTP server using fastapi-mail.

All settings are loaded from the application configuration. The TEMPLATE_FOLDER is set relative to the current file location to find email HTML templates. :meta type: fastapi_mail.ConnectionConfig

async src.services.email.send_password_reset_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email to the user containing a link for password reset confirmation.

Generates a time-limited token and uses the ‘reset_password.html’ template.

Parameters:

  • email (pydantic.EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username for personalization.

  • host (str) – The base URL of the application to construct the reset link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue connecting to the mail server.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

async src.services.email.send_verification_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Parameters:

  • email (pydantic.EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username for personalization.

  • host (str) – The base URL of the application to construct the verification link.

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue connecting to the mail server.

class src.services.upload_file.UploadFileService(cloud_name, api_key, api_secret)¶

Bases: object

Service class for handling file uploads to Cloudinary.

Initializes the Cloudinary configuration using credentials.

Parameters:

  • cloud_name (str) – Cloudinary cloud name.

  • api_key (int) – Cloudinary API key.

  • api_secret (str) – Cloudinary API secret.

static upload_file(file, username) → str¶

Uploads a file stream to Cloudinary and generates a secure URL for the resource.

The public ID is constructed using the ‘RestApp/’ prefix and the provided username, ensuring overwriting on subsequent uploads with the same username. The returned URL is resized to 250x250 with a ‘fill’ crop.

Parameters:

  • file (fastapi.UploadFile) – The UploadFile object containing the file stream.

  • username (str) – The username used to uniquely identify the uploaded file (public ID).

Returns:

The generated URL for the cropped and uploaded image.

Return type:

str

async src.services.upload_file.get_uploader(settings: Settings = Depends(dependency=<function get_settings>, use_cache=True, scope=None)) → UploadFileService¶

FastAPI dependency function to provide an instance of UploadFileService.

It initializes the service with configuration settings retrieved via the get_settings dependency.

Parameters:

settings (src.conf.config.Settings) – The application configuration settings.

Returns:

An initialized UploadFileService instance.

Return type:

UploadFileService
